text: Tyrannical Rule
The Fimir with the highest rank rules and the lower casts follow without resistance. This is the way of the Fimir.
Slave Labour

Most physical labour such as building is done by slaves or Shearls, the lowest cast of Fimir. Since slaves are easier to come by than new Shearls, the Fimir have become adept in catching their prey alive.
Wealth Through Oppression
Fimir are neither creative nor skilful workers, which is why they exploit captives from other races for this purpose.
Break Their Will!
Slaves are systematically broken until they no longer have the willpower left to do anything more than working for their merciless masters.
Slave Preservation
Slaves are the basis for Fimir economy and must not be wasted. They will receive just enough food and care to avoid having them expire too quickly for there is always more work that needs to be done!
Blood Rituals
Fimir are sterile, but in secret and abhorrent rituals they may sacrifice captives to create more of their vile kind.
Despoilers
What the Fimir cannot create themselves they will take from the settlements of other races. And the Fimir are poor creators.
Looters
The Fimir race is cornered and dwindling. They will not waste anything and will take as much loot as they can from a victorious battle.
Expeditions
Fimir live in remote places and are used to long marches in order to reach villages to plunder or convoys to ambush.
Inhuman Resilience
Fimir are a hardy race, used to living in barren lands other races show little to no interest in. They survive wounds that would kill a man and recover remarkably fast from them.
Slave Caste

The lowest of the low, Shearls are expected to work themselves to death in peace times and throw themselves at the enemy to weaken them in war times. They are still Fimir however and their strength must not be underestimated.
Slave Elite
Some Shearls may develop traits or skills which increase their worth to the ruler - if only bearly.
Warrior Caste
The Fimm are the warrior caste of the Fimir, mightier, better equipped and much less numerous than the Shearls. They are the hard core of every Fimir army.
Warrior Elite
The members of the warrior caste receive the best equipment the colony has to offer. This makes them much more dangerous in battle.
Fimir Champions
The Matriarch of the Colony, the Meargh, will only allow the mightiest and cruellest of the Fimm to lead her armies.
Dark Magic
The Dirach, the mage caste of the Fimir, draw on dark magic and demonic pacts to enhance their powers.
Natural Magical Talents
Fimir who are born with the ability to wield magic have a natural talent in wielding the winds of magic and can naturally unleash simple but destructive spells against their enemies.
Dark Sorcerers
Fimir Balefiends only ever wield harmful magic and have terrifying destructive potential on the battlefield.
Masters of Mists
Often called Fog- or Mist-Demons, the Fimir never move without the cover of magically conjured mists, protecting them from the sun and the eyes of their enemies.
Protective Talismans
Most Fimir may carry crude pendants and talismans which are supposed to protect them from magic. Some of them even work.
Into the Grinder
Worthless creatures, weak and pitiful. Fight and die for the Dark Master!
Riders of Chaos
Like a tsunami, the riders in service to the Shadowlord sweep over the battlefield, leaving only death and devastation.
Mortal Champions
Many corrupted mortals serve Bel'akor. The most worthy among them receive the gifts of chaos undivided, unflinching warriors clad in unholy armour.
Things from the Swamps
Animated by dark magic similar to Necromancy, these unliving constructs of rotten wood and unlucky souls will crush their enemies without mercy.
Corrupted Monsters
The dim Giants, Glacial Dragon Ogre or the rare Frost Wyrms of the north are broken and bound to the Will of the Herald, a terrifying addition to his armies.
Slave Empire
The Fimir are constantly trying to rebuild their long fallen empire from forgotten times with slavery, cruelty and tyranny. Woe to the world should they ever succeed.
Fimir Superiority
Fimir make natural warriors superior to those of most races. Only their small numbers hold them back.
Magical Enhancements
The Champions of the Fimir will never fight fair and go into battle imbued with and protected by darkest magic.
The Host of the Herald
Be they mortal or monster, those under the banner of Bel'akor fight with unholy vigour and skill, their numbers growing with each successful battle.
Chaos Renegades
The Dark Gods have left the Fimir to die. Now the Fimir have a new master and the Chaos Gods will suffer for their betrayal.
Court of the Dark Master
Many mighty demons are bound to Be'lakor and will follow him into battle, even against their former masters.
Necoho's Support
Necoho the Doubter blesses your cause - as long as you oppose the major Chaos Gods that is.
In Kweethul's Name
Kweethul the Destroyer usually prefers Skaven worshippers, but as long as Be'lakor keeps burning down the cities of man and oppose the major Chaos Gods, Kweethul begrudgingly lends his support.
Zuvassin's Blessings
Zuvassin the Undoer enjoys nothing more than thwarting plans, especially the plans of the major Chaos Gods. As such Be'lakor receives his help, for now.
The Dark Master's Ascension
Be'lakor has cast aside the chains of the Chaos Gods, empowering his host of demons. Whether this challenge towards the Dark Gods will lead to doom or glory for the Fimir remains to be seen.
